meanings.definition: Worked out or produced by intense study or effort.
meanings.sent1: The elucubrated research paper impressed the teacher with its depth.
meanings.sent2: Her elucubrated artwork showcased her dedication to perfection.
meanings.sent3: The elucubrated crossword puzzle kept him entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: The elucubrated plan finally came to fruition after months of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The elucubrated novel captured the hearts of readers with its intricate plot.

meanings.definition: To produce by working late at night.
meanings.sent1: She elucubrated the project until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent2: He often elucubrated his best ideas during the quiet of the night.
meanings.sent3: The students elucubrated their group project under the glow of the moon.
meanings.sent4: The writer elucubrated his masterpiece while the world slept.
meanings.sent5: The scientist elucubrated a groundbreaking theory in the stillness of the night.
